properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 10:44PM PST until February 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAIN SNOW OVER THE WEEKEND...

.A system sliding south through the Pacific Northwest will bring
moderate to heavy mountain snow, especially over the Blues and
Wallowas. Snow will start Saturday morning and continue into
Sunday morning. Gusty winds could lead to areas of blowing and
drifting snow. More light mountain snow showers expected Sunday
afternoon into President's Day.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to
14 inches. Winds gusting 25 to 40 mph.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 10 AM PST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing and drifting snow possible,
leading to areas of reduced visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY
